quotes.quote: In this world of ours, the sparrow must live like a hawk if he is to fly at all.
A sparrow in the hand is better than a pigeon on the branch.
Look at the sparrows; they do not know what they will do in the next moment. Let us literally live from moment to moment.
Better a sparrow, living or dead, than no birdsong at all.
A certain traveler who knew many continents was asked what he found most remarkable of all. He replied: the ubiquity of sparrows.
He that doth the ravens feed, yea, providently caters for the sparrow.
To become a sparrow you don't have to be a crow.
Somewhere, a sparrow is singing in B minor.
The sparrows jumped before they knew how to fly, and they learned to fly only because they had jumped.
If you are a sparrow, don't attack the eagle; be wise! If you are an eagle, don't attack the sparrow; be just!
One hundred sparrow does not make one eagle.
One sparrow is worth a thousand gulls, When it sings. The gull sits on chimney-tops. He mocks the guinea, challenges The crow, inciting various modes. The sparrow requites one, without intent.
There is special providence in the fall of a sparrow.
The sparrow is sorry for the peacock at the burden of its tail.
The League is very well when sparrows shout, but no good at all when eagles fall out.
A spoken word is not a sparrow. Once it flies out, you can't catch it.
The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.
On a soft snow, even a sparrow leaves a trace; the important thing is to leave a trace on a steel plate.
The sparrow still falls.
It doesn't hurt. Nothing hurts except the small smiles and blushes that flash across the room like tiny sparrows.
One cannot bring up boys to be eagles and then expect them to be sparrows.
The sparrow flies south for the winter.
When the sparrow sings its final refrain, the hush is felt nowhere more deeply than in the heart of man.
Because nothing should be wasted In a world where sparrows work hard to prove there is enough.
Can a sparrow know how a stork feels?
Who would attempt to fly with the tiny wings of a sparrow when the mighty power of an eagle has been given him.
To the seeing eye life is mostly Sparrows.
If you're going to care about the fall of the sparrow you can't pick and choose who's going to be the sparrow. It's everybody.
The average sparrow is somethiing of a bore and the trouble is that all sparrows are average.
Shakespeare said: "There's a special providence in the fall of a sparrow." Everything happens perfectly.
